USAGE:
　/recordready [subcommand]

→Opens and closes the Duty Recorder interface.

　　Initiate a record ready check
　　to begin recording a duty.

USAGE:
　/bluespellbook [subcommand]

→Open and register active actions in the Blue Magic Spellbook.

>>Subcommands:
　**set "blue mage action" on**
　　Adds the specified blue
　　mage action to the list
　　of active actions in the
　　current set.
　** set "blue mage action" off**
　　Removes the specified blue
　　mage action from the list of
　　active actions in the current
　　set.
　**preset [active set 1-5]**
　　Load the specified set of
　　active actions.
　**clear**
　　Remove all active actions
　　from the current active
　　action set.

Opens the Blue Magic Spellbook when no subcommand is specified.

>>Examples:
　/bluespellbook set “Water Cannon”
　(Sets the blue mage action
　Water Cannon as an active
　action in the current set.

　/bluespellbook preset 2
　(Loads active set 2.)

USAGE:
　/dice [chat mode] [subcommand]

→Displays a random number between 0 and 999 in the specified chat channel. Displays in the current chat mode when no chat mode is specified.

>>Chat Modes:
　Party
　　**party**, **p**
　Alliance
　　**alliance**, **al**
　Free Company
　　**freecompany**, **fc**
　PvP Team
　　**pvpteam**, **pt**
　Linkshell
　　**linkshell1-8**, **l1-8**
　Cross-world Linkshell
　　**cwlinkshell1-8**, **cwl1-8**

>>Subcommands:
　**[upper limit]**
　　Set an upper limit to display a random number between 1 and the specified number. Displays a random number between 0 and 999 when no upper limit is specified.
　　Upper limit range: 2-999

>>Examples:
　/dice
　(Displays a random number
　in the current chat mode.)

　/dice 16
　(Displays a random number
　between 1 and 16 in the
　current chat mode.)

　/dice cwl1
　(Displays a random number
　in the Cross-world Linkshell 1
　channel.)

　/dice cwl1 16
　(Displays a random number
　between 1 and 16 in the
　Cross-world Linkshell 1
　channel.)

USAGE:
　/petglamour [summon] [glamour]

→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.

>>Summon Name:
　**Carbuncle**
　**Garuda-Egi**
　**Titan-Egi**
　**Ifrit-Egi**
　**Eos**

>>Glamour:
　**Carbuncle**
　**Emerald Carbuncle**
　**Topaz Carbuncle**
　**Ruby Carbuncle**
　**Garuda-Egi**
　**Titan-Egi**
　**Ifrit-Egi**
　**Selene**

The glamour will be removed when no glamour is specified.
Displays pet glamour settings in chat log when no subcommand is specified.

>>Example:
　/petglamour "Garuda-Egi" "Ruby Carbuncle"
　(Garuda-Egi will appear glamoured as Ruby Carbuncle.)
　/petglamour "Garuda-Egi"
　(Returns Garuda-Egi to default appearance.)
　/petglamour
　(Displays pet glamour settings.)

USAGE:
　/petsize [summon] [size]

→Alter the size of select summons. Command not applicable in PvP instances. These settings will not apply to other players.

>>Egi Name:
　Demi-Bahamut
　Demi-Phoenix
　Ruby Ifrit
　Topaz Titan
　Emerald Garuda
　Solar Bahamut
　all

>>Size:
　**large**
　　Set summon size to large.
　**medium**
　　Set summon size to medium.
　**small**
　　Set summon size to small.

Toggles between small, medium, and large when no size is specified. Returns an error when attempting to toggle using “all.”

>>Example:
　/petsize "Ruby Ifrit" "small"
　(Set Ruby Ifrit's size to small.)

　**event**, **lookingforparty**, **recruit**,
　**lookingtomeld**, **newadventurer**,
　**mentor**, **tradementor**,
　**pvementor**, **pvpmentor**,
　**roleplay**, **returner**
【Class & Job】

　**BSM**, **ARM**, **GSM**, **LTW**, **WVR**,

　　Set the specified enemy sign to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　**waymark "waymark name" [#1] [#2]**
　　Set the specified waymark to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　**change [number]**
　　Replace current hotbar with hotbar [number].  If "next" or "prev" is entered in [number], then you can scroll through the pages of hotbar 1.
　**copy [job 1] [#1] [job 2] [#2]**
　　Copy the contents of [job 1] hotbar [#1] to the [job 2] hotbar [#2].
　　The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current job.
　　The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a job to specify your shared hotbar.
　**display [number] on**
　　Display hotbar [number].
　**display [number] off**
　　Hide hotbar [number].
　**display [number]**
　　Toggle on/off hotbar [number].
　**share [number] on**
　　Make hotbar [number] shared.
　**share [number] off**
　　Unshare hotbar [number] and assign it to your current job.
　**share [number]**
　　Toggle between on/off.
　**remove [#1] [#2]**
　　Remove the action assigned to slot [#2] on hotbar [#1].
　　Replace [#2] with "all" to remove all actions from hotbar [#1].
